description: Download Student Finance England application forms and guidance notes - including forms PN1, PR1, PTL1, PFF2 and CYI.

details.body:
Download student finance forms and guidance notes for Student Finance England, including forms:

  • PN1, PR1, PTL1 and PTMN for students
  • PFF2 and CYI for parents and partners
  • EU23N for students who qualify for full-time Tuition Fee support only and are studying in England
  • EUPTL1 for students who qualify for part-time Tuition Fee support only and are studying in England
  • DSA1 for Disabled Students’ Allowance (DSA)

Before you start

You need to check whether you qualify for a Tuition Fee Loan and help with living costs before you apply.

The forms are different for students from Scotland, students from Wales and students from Northern Ireland.

Download student finance forms

For braille or alternative formats contact the helpline. If you email, include your contact details and the format you need.

Helpline - alternative formats only
brailleandlargefonts@slc.co.uk
0141 243 3686
Find out about call charges

You can call Student Finance England if you want to apply online but you cannot use a computer without help.

nodes.body:
You should apply online for help with your tuition and living costs.

If you cannot apply online, use form PR1.

Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 PR1 - form (PDF, 376KB)
2023 to 2024 PR1 - guidance notes (PDF, 108KB)

The deadline is 9 months after the first day of the course’s academic year. Academic years begin on 1 September, 1 January, 1 April and 1 July. Ask someone who runs your course if you do not know which one applies.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ

Next steps

How to apply for student finance

nodes.title: Student finance - application form

nodes.body:
If you have not included your UK passport details in your application, use the passport details form.

Download ‘UK passport details form’

Do not send your UK passport.

If you do not have a UK passport

If you do not have a UK passport (or it has expired), you can either:

  • upload a copy of your birth or adoption certificate to your student finance account
  • send a copy of your birth or adoption certificate to Student Finance England by post

If you’re sending your original birth or adoption certificate by post

Include your name and address. You should also include your customer reference number if you have one. This is an 11-digit number. You can find it on letters or emails you’ve had from Student Finance England.

Where to send your form or certificate

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ

Next steps

How to apply for student finance

nodes.title: Proof of identity

nodes.body:
Some student finance is based on household income.

You must send your income details for the 2021 to 2022 tax year if you’re the student’s:

  • parent (if they’re under 25 and depend on you for money)
  • partner (if they’re 25 or over, or financially independent from their parents)

Do this online as part of the student’s application.

If you cannot do it online, use form PFF2.

Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 PFF2 - income details form

If your income has gone down since 2021 to 2022

If you think your income has dropped by 15% or more since the 2021 to 2022 tax year you’ll need to do both of the following:

  • submit your 2021 to 2022 income details using form PFF2
  • complete a CYI form (to ask for the student finance to be based on your expected 2023 to 2024 tax year income)
Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 PFF2 - income details form
2023 to 2024 CYI - income details form
2023 to 2024 Tax return guide (PDF, 52KB)

You need to provide income details for both tax years to show that your income has fallen by at least 15%.

If you’re the parent of a student

Make sure you provide income details for your partner if you have one.

Income means household income.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ

Next steps

How to apply for student finance
nodes.title: Parents and partners - forms

nodes.body:
Some student finance is based on household income.

You must send your income details for the 2020 to 2021 tax year if you’re the student’s:

  • parent (if they’re under 25 and depend on you for money)

  • partner (if they’re 25 or over, or financially independent from their parents)

Do this online as part of the student’s application.

If you cannot do it online, use form PFF2.

Academic year Form
2022 to 2023 PFF2 - income details form (PDF, 320KB)

If your income has gone down since 2020 to 2021

If you think your income has dropped by 15% or more since the 2020 to 2021 tax year you’ll need to do both of the following:

  • submit your 2020 to 2021 income details using form PFF2
  • complete a CYI form (to ask for the student finance to be based on your expected 2022 to 2023 tax year income)
Academic year Form
2022 to 2023 PFF2 - income details form (PDF, 320KB)
2022 to 2023 CYI - current tax year income assessment form (PDF, 77KB)
2022 to 2023 Tax return guide (PDF, 52KB)

You need to provide income details for both tax years to show that your income has fallen by at least 15%.

If you’re the parent of a student

Make sure you provide income details for your partner if you have one.

Income means household income.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ
nodes.title: Parents and partners - forms

nodes.body:
Fill in the DSA1 full form if for this academic year you’ve either:

  • not applied for any student finance
  • applied for a Postgraduate Loan
Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 DSA1 - full form (PDF, 700KB)
2023 to 2024 DSA1 - guidance notes (PDF, 106KB)

Fill in the DSA slim form if in this academic year you’ve already applied for any student finance that is not a Postgraduate Loan.

You’ll need to put your Customer Reference Number (CRN) in the form.

Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 DSA - slim form (PDF, 109KB)

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ

Next steps

Disabled Students’ Allowance

nodes.title: Disabled Students' Allowance - expenses

nodes.body:
If you have already completed your main student finance application and now want to apply for an Adult Dependants’ Grant, Parents’ Learning Allowance, a Childcare Grant, or to apply for a Childcare Grant for another child.

If you have not already applied for student finance you need to go back and start again and choose ‘apply for student loans and grants’.

Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 Application form for Dependants’ Grants (PDF, 106KB)

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ

Next steps

Childcare Grant
nodes.title: Childcare Grant

nodes.body:
Fill in the application form for a Dependant’s Grant if you have completed your main student finance application and now want to apply for an Adult Dependants’ Grant, Parents’ Learning Allowance, a Childcare Grant, or a Childcare Grant for another child.

If you have not already applied for student finance you need to go back and start again and choose ‘apply for student loans and grants’.

Academic year Form
2022 to 2023 Application form for Dependants’ Grants (PDF, 94KB)

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ

Next steps

Childcare Grant
nodes.title: Childcare Grant

nodes.body:
At the end of each term confirm your actual childcare costs. Use the CCG2 form for the academic year the costs relate to.

Academic year Form
2018 to 2019 CCG2: Childcare Costs Confirmation Form 2018 to 2019 (PDF, 320KB)

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ

Next steps

Childcare Grant
nodes.title: ORPHANED - Childcare Grant - cost confirmation (NO LONGER NEEDED)

nodes.body:
Use the travel expenses form for the academic year you studied abroad.

Student Finance England will automatically send you:

  • a Course Abroad Form if you need to fill it in
  • a Clinical Study Travel Expenses Form if you’re eligible

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ

Next steps

Travel grants

nodes.title: Student finance - application form

nodes.body:
To apply for a Fee Grant and Course Grant, download and fill in form PTGC.

Academic year Form
2019 to 2020 PTGC - form (PDF, 117KB)
2019 to 2020 PTGC - guidance notes (PDF, 57KB)

You can apply up to 9 months after your course starts.

If you or your partner get benefits

You also need to download and fill in form CB1 (PDF, 72KB) if you or your partner get any of the following:

  • Universal Credit
  • Income Support
  • Income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA)
  • Income-related Employment Support Allowance (ESA)
  • Housing Benefit
  • Local Housing Allowance

If your circumstances have changed

You need to download and fill in form CO2 (PDF, 85KB) if you’ve changed any of the following since you last applied for funding:

  • your course, or you’ve left it
  • university or college
  • your name, address or contact details

nodes.title: Disabled Students' Allowance - expenses

nodes.body:
To apply for a Tuition Fee Loan use form EUPR1A.

Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 EUPR1A - form (PDF, 185KB)

Additional information

You may need to include additional information on the following forms.

Form When to use the form
EUTFLR - form (PDF, 137KB) To change the amount of loan you want to apply for
Evidence factsheet List of evidence to send with your application - for example proof of identity or income
EUCO1 - form (PDF, 221KB) To update your course, name and other details

The deadline is 9 months after the first day of the course’s academic year. Academic years begin on 1 September, 1 January, 1 April and 1 July. Ask someone who runs your course if you do not know which one applies.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance Services
Student Loans Company
PO Box 89
Darlington
County Durham
DL1 9AZ
United Kingdom
nodes.title: Continuing students studying full-time in England who qualify for Tuition Fee Loan only

nodes.body:
To apply for a Tuition Fee Loan use form EU23N.

Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 EU23N - form and notes (PDF, 949KB)

Additional information

You may need to include additional information on the following forms.

Form When to use the form
EUTFLR - form (PDF, 137KB) To change the amount of loan you want to apply for
Evidence factsheet List of evidence to send with your application - for example, proof of identity or income
Certifier checklist (PDF, 129KB) Get the person who verifies your evidence to sign this form
EUCO1 - form (PDF, 221KB) To update your course, name and other details

The deadline is 9 months after the first day of the course’s academic year. Academic years begin on 1 September, 1 January, 1 April and 1 July. Ask someone who runs your course if you do not know which one applies.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance Services
Student Loans Company
PO Box 89
Darlington
County Durham
DL1 9AZ
United Kingdom

nodes.title: EU part-time student

nodes.body:
If your nationality or residency status means you can only apply for help with tuition fees, you need to use the EUPTLC form.

You apply in a different way if you can only get help with tuition fees because you’re studying a distance learning course. You can either apply online, or use the forms for courses that started after August 2018 or the forms for courses that started before August 2018.

EUPTLC form

Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 EUPTLC – form and guidance notes

Additional information

You may need to include additional information on the following forms:

Form When to use the form
EUTFLR – form To change the amount of loan you want to apply for
Evidence factsheet List of evidence to send with your application, for example proof of identity or income
Certifier checklist Get the person who verifies your evidence to sign this form
EUCO1 – form To update your course, name and other details

The deadline is 9 months after the first day of the course’s academic year. Academic years begin on 1 September, 1 January, 1 April and 1 July. Ask someone who runs your course if you do not know which one applies.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance Services
Student Loans Company
PO Box 89
Darlington
County Durham
DL1 9AZ
United Kingdom
nodes.title: Continuing students studying part-time in England who qualify for Tuition Fee Loan only

nodes.body:
If your nationality or residency status means you can only apply for help with tuition fees, you need to use the EUPTL1 form.

You apply in a different way if you can only get help with tuition fees because you’re studying a distance learning course. You can either apply online, or use the forms for courses that started after August 2018 or the forms for courses that started before August 2018.

EUPTL1 form

Academic year Form
2023 to 2024 EUPTL1 – form and guidance notes

Additional information

You may need to include additional information on the following forms:

Form When to use the form
EUTFLR – form To change the amount of loan you want to apply for
Evidence factsheet List of evidence to send with your application, for example proof of identity or income
Certifier checklist Get the person who verifies your evidence to sign this form
EUCO1 – form To update your course, name and other details

The deadline is 9 months after the first day of the course’s academic year. Academic years begin on 1 September, 1 January, 1 April and 1 July. Ask someone who runs your course if you do not know which one applies.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance Services
Student Loans Company
PO Box 89
Darlington
County Durham
DL1 9AZ
United Kingdom
nodes.title: New students studying part-time in England who qualify for Tuition Fee Loan only

nodes.body:
Some student finance is based on income.

You must send your income details for the 2020 to 2021 tax year. Do this online as part of the student application.

If you cannot do it online, use form NMT to MT.

Your parents or partner may also need to provide details of their income - they can do this online or use form PFF2.

Academic year Form
2022 to 2023 NMT to MT – applying for student finance based on household income form
2022 to 2023 PFF2 – income details form

Income means your household income.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ
nodes.title: Update your household income

nodes.body:
Some student finance is based on income.

You must send your income details for the 2018 to 2019 tax year. Do this online as part of the student’s application. If you cannot do it online, use form PFF2.

If you think your income has dropped by 15% or more since the 2018 to 2019 tax year you’ll need to do both of the following:

  • submit your 2018 to 2019 income details using form PFF2
  • complete a CYI form (to ask for the student finance to be based on your expected income for the 2020 to 2021 tax year)
Academic year Form
2020 to 2021 PFF2 – income details form (PDF, 320KB)
2020 to 2021 CYI – current tax year income assessment form (PDF, 76KB)

Income means your household income.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ
nodes.title: Send your parent or partner’s income details

nodes.body:
You should apply online for a Maintenance Loan.

If you cannot apply online, use form PTMN.

You can also apply for a Tuition Fee Loan.

Academic year Form
2022 to 2023 PTMN - form and guidance notes

The deadline is 9 months after the first day of the course’s academic year. Academic years begin on 1 September, 1 January, 1 April and 1 July. Ask someone who runs your course if you do not know which one applies.

Where to send your forms

Student Finance England
PO Box 210
Darlington
DL1 9HJ
